attributes.action: Remove the NHS from political control. HM Government to set NHS budgets only.
attributes.background: The NHS should be run by a board of governors who are accountable to Parliament, like the BBC, with sensible targets, acceptable staffing levels and long-term plans. Politicians could then honestly debate the real issue, FUNDING, allowing a clear choice between parties which would interest voters.
attributes.additional_details: Constant reorganisation by politicians has damaged the NHS: it is divisive and saps energy, focus and productivity; there has been little time for benefits to show. Some change has been driven by political ideology from both sides without much clinical benefit. Governments only look 5 years ahead, until the next election. A quick fix for 5 years is no good. An independent but accountable, properly managed NHS would use research and sound experience to make plans for us all for the long term.

attributes.action: Negotiate personal EU membership for certain categories of UK citizen.
attributes.background: Citizens with either: 1. A spouse with EU citizenship; or 2. Pension rights in an EU member state; have had their European homeland taken from them and their family lives crippled. Personal EU membership confirmed by an official passport endorsement would help to mitigate that injustice.
attributes.additional_details:
Under Personal Membership of the EU, eligible individuals would benefit from Non-discrimination and Citizenship of the Union as described in Part Two of the Consolidated Treaties and Charter of Fundamental Rights, Articles 18–25.
http://europa.eu/pol/pdf/consolidated-treaties_en.pdf#page=57

attributes.action: Make it Illegal to prescribe paracetamol
attributes.background: In 2015 over 22 million prescriptions for paracetamol were written at a cost to tax payers of over £80 million pounds – an average cost of £3.67 per prescription.....paracetamol can be purchased for 19p!!!!!

attributes.action: Abolish university fees: we should be entitled to free education.
attributes.background: Fees for attending university in England have rocketed. Now the government has announced that student maintenance grants will be replaced with loans in 2016, meaning that students could end up in up to £50,000 in debt.

attributes.action: Pass legislation to restrict betting on referenda and general elections.
attributes.background: Shortly before the EU Referendum, bookmakers' odds for Remain were 1/4, while those for Leave were 5/1. Such odds have the potential to influence voting, irrespective of the political issues at stake. It is reported that 69 per cent of individual bets were placed on Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Reference: Financial Times dated 26 June 2016
"Brexit wagers set new record for non-sports bets" by Paul McClean.

attributes.action: A public enquiry to review why people voted as they did in the EU referendum.
attributes.background:
It too easy for politicians just to say referendum complete, democracy has been served. Public opinion must be present throughout the whole process, to ensure we receive a democratic outcome. 

This is a massive decision in the country's history we should find out the facts before we progress.
attributes.additional_details:
UK decision makers must be armed with infomation which details the reasons why the UK electorate voted as they did. Enabling these decision makers to formulate the next steps in a way which is in line with public opinion.

Lies have been told on both sides.

People seem to have been unaware of possible economic consequences.

Decisions have been revaluated.

Votes may have been cast as a protest against the UK government.

attributes.action: Lets Join The Nordic Alliance. Post Brexit
attributes.background: Iceland wants the UK to join Nordic alliance, and I do too! Not only is the Nordic alliance built from some of the most amazing coolest countries on the planet, we are also very closely linked in our customs and our history.
attributes.additional_details:
Iceland wants the UK to join Nordic alliance, and I do too! Not only is the Nordic alliance built from some of the most amazing coolest countries on the planet, we are also very closely linked in our customs and our history.

"When Britain leaves the EU, we will see a triangle that covers a large part of the globe: Greenland, Iceland, the Faroe Islands, Norway - and now the United Kingdom,” said Iceland’s President Olafur Ragnar Grimsson

attributes.action: If a petition gets 250,000 signatures, it should trigger a national referendum
attributes.background:
Engagement with politics is continuing to decline. Direct democracy is part of the solution. 

When an official petition receives around 250,000 signatures, it should result in an official, binding referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
In Switzerland, when around 0.6% of the population signs a petition, it triggers a referendum (https://www.ch.ch/en/referendum/). This system works well in a country of more than eight million people, and there is no reason why it wouldn't work well in the UK.

A committee or group should be set up to administer these petitions so they do not needlessly consume government time. Note that only a small number of petitions a year would receive the needed signatures.

attributes.action: All companies relocating to the EU to pay all tax owing to the exchequer.
attributes.background: Vodafone may quit the UK as a result of the Brexit refrendum. HMRC did a deal with them recently. If any company relocates to within the EU, HMRC must annul any deals made, audit them properly and they must pay all tax owing from the last ten years plus interest immediately.

attributes.action: Make Friday a Half working day
attributes.background: Gives everyone a longer weekend. People will be happier and less stressed.

attributes.action: make a new law to force landlords to allow pets in rented properties
attributes.background: all pets deserve a loving home and this is being taken away by landlords refusing to allow pets so I ask all animal lovers to support this and get the government to make a new law forcing landlords to allow pets in rented properties

attributes.action: Referendum on income tax
attributes.background:
Holding a referendum has proven to be an effective and democratic way to decide the nation's future in matters of highest importance.
We therefore propose to hold a referendum to decide to abolish the income tax.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015 the tax payers have paid a weekly amount of £3.1billion in
income tax across all bands. We propose to abolish such mandatory
payment to the state, and instead to take back control of this money
and fund the NHS with an additional £3.1billion per week.
In order to comply with the rules of democracy we suggest that no less than the majority (i.e. 23,299,988 people) of eligible voters must be in favour. We can entrust the voters to make the right decision for
the Country.

attributes.action: Investigate UK areas of deep social dislocation and propose remedial measures
attributes.background: The result of the EU Referendum on 23 June revealed significant differences between different parts of the UK. Polls also revealed sharply constrasting social circumstances and motivations for the different votes. There appears to be a causative correlation between vote and social circumstances.
attributes.additional_details:
The poll conducted by Lord Ashcroft shows significant social, educational and age differences between the two sides of the EU Referendum votes: http://lordashcroftpolls.com/2016/06/how-the-united-kingdom-voted-and-why/
The differences in the voting in different parts of the country are readily available.

attributes.action: Debate triggering Art.50 and withdrawing from the EU is in the national interest
attributes.background: The referendum result was decided on a narrow percentage majority and already the consequences have been significant. It is the duty of members of the House to consider the national interest and regional and age profile disparity in the results suggests that this is not a settled matter.

attributes.action: In 2018 hold a referendum on whether negotiated EU Exit terms are acceptable.
attributes.background:
Suggested:
The UK will shortly be leaving the European Union; How should the UK continue trading with the EU? 
1. Trade on the terms of the draft Exit treaty  between the UK and EU? 
2. Trade with the EU only on World Trade Organization rules, until a better Trade Agreement with the EU is agreed?
attributes.additional_details:
This new referendum will seek to ensure that the will of the majority that voted to LEAVE is not watered down by weak UK negotiators who, to gain free trade arrangements, might give away the control of free-movement-of-labour that was voted for. 

Or secondly if the EU is dogmatic and unwilling to include UK control of movement-of-labour this vote effectively gives those who voted to REMAIN  a second referendum.

attributes.action: If a fathers name isn't on the birth certificate women shouldn't claim CSA
attributes.background: If women chose not to put the fathers name on the birth certificate they SHOULDN'T have the right to claim CSA unless both parents are on the certificate

attributes.action: Don't scrap the right to buy on uk council homes
attributes.background:
Don't  scrap  the right to buy scheme for uk council homes 


The right to buy  is the only way most people will ever get on the housing ladder

attributes.action: Discuss a National Coalition government after the EU referendum result
attributes.background: Britain exiting the EU is the biggest challenge to face the UK since World War Two. Unity is required and there are concerns of a rise in too far to the right politics.
attributes.additional_details: Exiting Europe is the biggest challenge to face the UK since World War Two. A rise in racism and contempt has been reported by immigrants and by people of a minority ethnicity and I feel the British people need reassurances that the goverment won't be led too far right. A Tory lead coalition government with Labour and SNP should be discussed. I feel the coalition will offer stability and offer the best negotiations for the British people when exiting the EU.

attributes.action: Open age restrictions for Lifetime ISA
attributes.background:
Allow to open and contribute until 50 years old
Currently only available to 18 to 40 years of age
Pays 25% bonus pa on £4k

attributes.action: Ensure the police can protect minority groups while the Brexit talks take place
attributes.background: In light of the recent increase in racist attacks in the immediate aftermath of the Brexit vote, we call on the government to condemn these attacks in the strongest language and ensure that the police have the resources to protect all our minority populations during the Brexit negotiations.

attributes.action: Ensure that all bureaucrats involved in EU exit talks are elected non-experts
attributes.background:
The British people have demonstrated their desire to free themselves from government by unelected bureaucrats and so-called experts.
The will of the people must be respected: all those involved in EU exit negotiations should have no expertise and should be elected directly to the role.
attributes.additional_details:
Much of the campaign to leave the EU focused on our lives being run by unelected bureaucrats and the 'misinformation' provided by experts. The massive 3.8% majority for leave in the referendum is a clear mandate to end the negative influence of unelected bureaucrats and experts.
Anyone involved in EU exit talks should be directly elected. Given the timeframe of the negotiations, their terms of office should be for 8 months, allowing us to assess their performance and get rid of them if need be.

attributes.action: 2nd referendum for 16-50 year olds
attributes.background: Almost two thirds of over 60s voted in favour of Brexit and those under 49 voted to remain (according to advance polling). Three quarters of people aged 18-24 voted to remain. It is not fair that the older generation have dominated a large percentage of votes and decided the future for the young.
attributes.additional_details: Statistics from Buzzfeed article: https://www.buzzfeed.com/patricksmith/young-people-are-angry-at-old-people-for-voting-leave?utm_term=.eo43KzXBMe#.eo43KzXBMe

attributes.action: During referendums all politicians swear before a judge to tell the whole truth
attributes.background: the public should be able to take demonstratable factual evidence from politicians on important subjects usually called in referendums. The politicians should clearly state what are facts and what is speculation & as in a court should be asked to swear an oath which supports this.
attributes.additional_details: The 2016 EU referendum on either was clearly not based on a facts or truths. This has the potential for causing great harm.

attributes.action: Declare EU referendum void as 16 & 17 year olds were denied the vote
attributes.background: The EU referendum is a significant constitutional event.  It will affect the rights and opportunities of all UK citizens for many years to come. The 16 & 17 year old should have been given a vote. The precedent for this already having been established for the recent Scottish Independence referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The size of the youth vote is large enough to have had a material effect on the outcome of the election

attributes.action: Make Government & Politics an optional GCSE subject
attributes.background: Government & Politics is currently not an existing GCSE qualification, with increased voter apathy in particular amongst young people, giving them the tools to engage in the political process, should they wish, from an earlier age than currently exists may increase political participation.
attributes.additional_details: In the EU Referendum (2016) voter turnout amongst 18-24 year olds was 36% (@SkyData), however the turnout for the referendum as a whole was 72% showing voter apathy to be particular prevalent amongst the young.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the UK's policy on the EU with options for different plans.
attributes.background:
A referendum not grouping policies on what we should do about the EU so the decision isn't made without asking the people.

Suggested options -

Remain in the EU
Leave but remain in the EEA
Leave the EU & EEA, keeping trade agreements 
Leave all EU agreements
attributes.additional_details:
After the July referendum MPs are now discussing what we should do and when we should do it. 

This is because the options weren't clear enough and it is in the interests of democracy to ask the population how they want to deal with Europe with regards to the key issues of membership, economy, trade and immigration.

In short, as we currently have no public consensus on a plan, we are currently set to have a new Prime Minister elected only by Tory Party members choose what we do.

attributes.action: Post-Brexit breakup reunion with Scotland to re-join EU
attributes.background: Should the UK break up after leaveing the EU, following the EU Referendum result, we the undersigned call upon HM Government to consider uniting with an independent Scotland, thus allowing a re-entry into the EU under a Scottish alliance.

attributes.action: Allow the Black Country to seperate from the union, and ignore laws of London.
attributes.background:
After the EU Referendum, it has been suggested that the city of London break away from the Union. 
To save any hassle, we suggest that the Black Country break away from the rule of London, and set up our own system of government and law, as London wants nothing to do with the nation.

attributes.action: EU nationals contributing to UK economy for at least 15 years to get citizenship
attributes.background: Following the referendum EU nationals who have made their lives in the UK,  who contribute to society by working and paying taxes are worried about their future. No one knows what the negotiations will bring. The proposal is for EU nationals in the UK for at least 15 years to gain Citizenship.
attributes.additional_details: Being a contributing factor to the economy of the UK for this average length of time proves dedication to be part of the UK society and culture. EU nationals who have built their lives in the UK, are at risk of facing visa/work restrictions. Citizenship or indefinite right to remain for the contributors.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on rejoining the EU every tenth year, starting June 2026.
attributes.background:
Young people voted overwhelmingly to stay in the EU (about 75% of those aged 18-24).

To give them hope, we're asking that in June 2026, and in every tenth June afterwards so long as Britain is outside the EU, a referendum be held on the question "Should Britain now apply to rejoin the EU?".

attributes.action: Open The United Kingdom's borders for free trade with everyone in the world.
attributes.background: Further to the EU Referendum which voted for The United Kingdom to leave the European Union, I propose that we open our borders for the free movement of goods to and from anywhere in the world.

attributes.action: Cameron should call a state of emergency. The country is divided and in turmoil!
attributes.background: The leave vote was not decisive enough to justify changing all our lives

attributes.action: Create a separate PIP assesment for mental disabilities
attributes.background: The current PIP assessment is designed for physical disabilities and does not ask the correct questions for people with mental health issues. Therefore people with mental health issues are loosing out on funds they are entiltled too. MENTAL HEALTH MATTERS

attributes.action: Say No to a Norway style deal with the EU!
attributes.background:
A Government based think tank is considering negotiating a Norway Style deal with the EU!

This should not even be considered as it is a watered down version of our past liability with the EU and that is what we overwhelmingly voted to be rid of!
attributes.additional_details:
Norway STILL has free movement of immigrants from the EU. 

Our Commonwealth friends, the rest of the world and indeed Germany has already confirmed that they still want to trade with us, so we make our own deals with what suits us. For 43 years we have been trading with a strait jacket on, imposed on us by Europe in compliance with their many rules and regs that we have now voted to reject.


Please listen to the people that have asked for change and voted us out of the EU, do the right thing and look after the British people first and foremost for a change and help us to achieve our full potential, which is one of power and greatness.

If you agree, please sign the petition.

attributes.action: Represent remain voters equally within new government leadership framework
attributes.background: 48% of the voting public wanted to remain in the EU, it is unrepresentative and undemocratic that the leaders of our government should stand for a UK polar opposite to what we stand for. Significant Remain Tory representatives should have key roles in the upcoming changes within cabinet.
attributes.additional_details: Young members of voting demographic feel disenfranchised and as though they have unfairly lost out on something they believed in. 48% of the public who voted wish to remain in the EU and do not want a far right, nationalist government. In order for this proportion of the population to feel represented and valued as voters and citizens, those wishing to remain need to be represented equally by senior remain politicians in the new government framework after Cameron's formal resignation.

attributes.action: Make  winning majority vote in referendum (such as EU vote) need majority of 10%
attributes.background: Today's EU referendum results show that the country is very much in a 50/50 split with only approximately 4%  difference.  Since referendum are there for major countrywide decisions (rather than a 5 year government) a more decisive majority is needed.

attributes.action: Manchester and London to join Scotland and Stay in the EU
attributes.background:
In the referendum on EU membership Manchester voted to remain by 60.4%. London voted to remain at nearly 80% in some boroughs. Scotland also voted to remain.
As people of these areas we do not wish to leave the EU. 
We wish to join Scotland, declare independence from UK and remain part of the EU.

attributes.action: Stop closure of Lincoln Limb Clinic Services
attributes.background: From September 2016, Lincoln Limb Clinic will be closed and all appointments will be at Nottingham City Hospital. Patients are expected to travel up to a 161.4 mile round trip for an appointment. This is WRONG and will cause unnecessary toll on the young and older patients.
attributes.additional_details: This planned action is quoted as 'being in the interest of providing a better service' but in reality, no-one who uses Lincoln Clinic have complained about the service they receive. This is just another money saving measure, removing a service NHS Management know that amputees need, thus forcing us to accept the changes....They have us over a barrel. Please sign this petition and help us to try and keep our service local for the benefit of patients, not the 'bean counters' Thankyou

attributes.action: Force credit/debit card providers allow a customer block on contactless payments
attributes.background: Contactless payments are a security risk. They permit criminals to collect users data using unauthorised scanners, the "Contactless Infusion X5" being sold by "CC Buddies" for £500, is just one of them.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see the following recent Daily Star article:-

http://www.dailystar.co.uk/news/latest-news/522417/Fraud-clone-bank-cards-contactless-device

attributes.action: A review of the British High Comission Visa Department in Pakistan.
attributes.background: The British High Comission has been rejecting thousands of UK Visa applicants from Pakistan in a unsophisticated way. So I plead to the British Government to review the ongoing in Pakistan's visa department, as rate of rejection is currently higher than ever, and this is not humanly right.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, the British High Commission charges fees from Rs14,000 to Rs100,000 for visas of different categories and durations. In some cases Pakistanis have submitted a number of a applications to the BHC for visas, and paid the fee a number of times, only to be turned down without a justifiable reason. This could be in fear of terrorism, which is understandable at the current time, however this does not highlight why thousands of applicants are being tuned down without a justified reason.

attributes.action: Oppose changes to make you pay full market rent on your council home.
attributes.background: A Government Housing and Planning Bill will see people even on modest incomes threatened with the prospect of paying full market rent in their council and housing association homes (http://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN06804/SN06804.pdf).
attributes.additional_details: Ending secure council tenancies means the government is legislating to deny families a stable home.

attributes.action: Stop councils forcing homeless tenants to stay past a section 21
attributes.background:
Local housing authorities are forcing private tenants to stay after the end date of a section 21, and making them wait until bailiff evictions. The tenant is responsible for the court and bailiff costs.
If the tenant does not stay, they are deemed intentionally homeless and refused help.
attributes.additional_details: Both local councils and shelter England advice the tenant to stay after the end of the section 21 date. Why should the tenant be liable for cost when following the councils guidance? Why should landlords have to take tenants to court to get their properties back.? Why are councils using a form of blackmail to get tenants to do what they want?

attributes.action: Reduce planning restrictions when converting derelict land into amenity space
attributes.background: I am 77 year old passionate gardener trying to rescue derelict land.  It had lots of non-native invasive weeds. I have transformed the space into a haven for wildlife. Salford council have taken over a year to grant permission, costing me 6k on surveys and fees. This should be quicker and cheaper.
attributes.additional_details:
Japanese Knotweed and Himalayan Balsam, invasive weeds:
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/prevent-the-spread-of-harmful-invasive-and-non-native-plants

Before and after pictures of the derelict land in question:
https://thesecretvalley.com/2014/05/27/swan/
(I am cutting down Himalayan Balsam with a scythe)

Himalayan Balsam
https://thesecretvalley.com/2012/05/09/himalayan-bolsom/

Japanese knotweed
https://thesecretvalley.com/2012/08/09/clearing-and-burning-the-japanese-knotweed/

attributes.action: Stop children from being punished for their hair at school.
attributes.background: I believe that all children in the UK should be allowed to have a hairstyle that they like, rather than being force to have hair that is considered 'decent' by the school. Children should not be punished for having a hair style that expresses their personality, but schools still have the right to.
attributes.additional_details: My son got placed in isolation for going into school with short hair a few months ago. I can understand their stance on no makeup or nail polish (not that this would apply to my child) due to it able to be changed before and after school. However, someone cannot change the length or colour of their hair. Whilst my child broke the school rules without good reason, a friend of his has a mum that was diagnosed with cancer. So, his friend shaved his head to support her but got punished.

attributes.action: Boycott American trade in the event of Donald Trump being elected US president
attributes.background: This petition supports the boycott of US trade in the event of Donald Trump being elected president.  Trump endorses a manifesto built on intolerance and a lack of respect for the natural resources we should be protecting.  The implications of his election would impact far beyond the US borders.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.cbsnews.com/media/is-donald-trump-a-menace-to-the-global-economy/

http://edition.cnn.com/2015/12/07/politics/donald-trump-muslim-ban-immigration/

http://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/may/04/donald-trumps-election-will-derail-paris-climate-deal-warns-its-architect

http://www.wsj.com/articles/world-leaders-assess-a-potential-donald-trump-presidency-1462739253

http://www.nationalreview.com/article/434660/donald-trump-foreign-policy-incoherent-shallow

attributes.action: Orgnanise a blockade of the Libyan coast to stop people trafficking.
attributes.background: Around 150,000 migrants travelled from Libya to Italy by boat last year and, so far this year, more than 37,000 people have been intercepted in the Mediterranean and taken to Italian ports. Hundreds are believed to have died after their overloaded vessels sank or capsized.
attributes.additional_details: Lord West, ex-First Sealord and Chief of Naval Staff, said such a measure would require 10 Navy frigates and destroyers, along with helicopters, drones and other intelligence and surveillance capability

attributes.action: Stop the winding down of mobile Blood Donor Units nationally
attributes.background: Which is believed to be policy by end of 2016
attributes.additional_details: Blood is given freely and is a needed resource for our medical services, if this policy goes ahead I am sure that the numbers of donors will reduce dramatically, which could effect many lives

attributes.action: Products with lithium batteries to have a child-safe fastening and quantum coat
attributes.background: Rising incidence of 'button batteries' containing lithium manganese cause serious/fatal injuries in children. There are 3,000 ingestions of these batteries p.a. and 48 deaths. The NHS recently issued a public announcement re dangers, following 5 serious injuries and 1 fatality in NW England alone.
attributes.additional_details:
1) The incidence of button battery injuries in the North West of England:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-manchester-29610570

2) http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-2969115/How-small-batteries-new-child-killer-look-innocuous-cause-utterly-horrific-internal-burns.html

3) Statistical analysis:
www.poison.org/battery/fatalcases

4) http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/two-year-old-girl-dies-after-swallowing-button-battery-over-christmas-in-us-a6793846.html

attributes.action: Stop smoking on bar verandahs/beer gardens/restaurant street tables
attributes.background: Why must i be confined to the indoors? Why must I have to miss out on enjoying warm days on verandahs/beer gardens because of someone elses anti social habits?
attributes.additional_details: The US and I believe some places in Scandinavia have already got this in place

attributes.action: Pedestrian crossings by all schools
attributes.background: 2incidents have happened at my daughters school recently, I have wrote to local council to ask about a pedestrian crossing and their response was until there is a fatality, the answer is no! This IS DISGRACEFUL. I petition for crossings for all parents to get their children to school safely.
